data.body: Show the steps of Kosaraju’s algorithm to find the Strongly Connected Components of the graph below. You should assume that the adjacency list for each node is given in numerical order e.g., the adjacency list for node 10 is {0, 8} and the adjacency list for node 0 is {3, 5}.
data.solution:
Step 1: Perform DFS on Original Graph
DFS(0)
  DFS(3)
    DFS(8)
      DFS(9)
        DFS(2)
          DFS(7)
            *8 already visited*
            DFS(11)
              *2 already visited*
              *9 already visited*
    DFS(10)
      *0 already visited*
      *8 already visited*
  DFS(5)
    *11 already visited*
Construct stack in order finishing times such that stack is in the order: 11, 7, 2, 9, 8, 10, 3, 5, 0
Step 2: Reverse the edge directions for the transposed graph
Step 3: Perform DFS on transposed graph in reverse order of finish times (from the end of the stack first)
DFS(0)
  DFS(10)
    DFS(3)
      *0 already visited*
DFS(5)
  *0 already visited*
*3 already visited*
*10 already visited*
DFS(8)
  *3 already visited*
  DFS(7)
    DFS(2)
      DFS(9)
        *8 already visited*
        DFS(11)
          *5 already visited*
          *7 already visited*
      *11 already visited*
  *10 already visited*
*9 already visited*
*2 already visited*
*7 already visited*
*11 already visited*
Thus the connected components are: (0,3,10), (5), and (2,7,8,9,11)
